Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for bandwidth, latency, and redundancy for the ExpressRoute Direct service. Identify the applications and services that will utilize this connectivity.
Create a detailed design of the network architecture, including the placement of ExpressRoute Direct components, peering locations, and integration with existing on-premises and Azure networks.
Choose a connectivity provider that supports Azure ExpressRoute Direct and can meet the required Service Level Agreement (SLA) for bandwidth and latency.
Request the LOA from Microsoft for the ExpressRoute Direct service. This document authorizes the connectivity provider to provision the connection.
Create and configure the required circuits or connections in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Ensure they are provisioned in multiple locations for redundancy.
Submit the LOA to the chosen connectivity provider to initiate the provisioning of the physical connection.
Set up necessary peering configurations. Define VLANs, BGP peering, and route filters as per design requirements.
Enable required security measures, such as encryption (e.g., MACsec) on the circuits. Configure the required cryptographic keys and policies for securing the data link layer.
Configure BGP sessions between the on-premises routers and the Azure circuits. Ensure proper route advertisement and acceptance policies.
Perform thorough testing of the connectivity, including failover scenarios, throughput tests, and latency measurements to ensure the network meets the required specifications.
Establish redundant circuits and VPN connections to ensure high availability. Verify that failover mechanisms are functioning correctly.
Apply security best practices such as Network Security Groups (NSGs), Azure DDoS Protection, and access control policies. Ensure proper segmentation of network traffic.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor, Network Watcher, and third-party tools. Configure alerts for circuit status, BGP session drops, and performance metrics.
Document the network architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the setup.
Ensure the setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Use Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to continuously monitor the health and status of ExpressRoute circuits. Identify and investigate any anomalies or potential issues.
Check the stability of BGP sessions. Monitor for route flaps or unexpected changes in route advertisements that could impact ExpressRoute connectivity.
Analyze ExpressRoute circuit performance data to ensure operations within expected parameters. Investigate and address any performance deviations.
Perform failover tests to verify that redundant paths, including VPN backups, function correctly and can take over in case of primary ExpressRoute path failures.
Conduct audits of ExpressRoute configurations to ensure alignment with documented architecture and best practices for the service.
Keep ExpressRoute service documentation up-to-date, including operational procedures, configuration details, and troubleshooting guides.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding ExpressRoute performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
